sentence.Network_en: A 10 percent service charge is added in lieu of tipping.
sentence.Network_cn: 加收了10%的服务费以代替小费。

sentence.Network_en: The company offered us time off in lieu.
sentence.Network_cn: 公司叫我们用休假来代替.

sentence.Network_en: He left what little furniture he owned to his landlord in lieu of rent.
sentence.Network_cn: 他把自己仅有的那点家具留给了房东抵房租。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: via French from Latin locus 'place'

entry.def: If you do, get, or give one thing in lieu of another, you do, get, or give it instead of the other thing, because the two things are considered to have the same value or importance.

example.ex: He left what little furniture he owned to his landlord in lieu of rent.
example.tran: 他把自己仅有的那点家具留给了房东抵房租。

entry.def: If you do, get, or give something in lieu, you do, get, or give it instead of something else, because the two things are considered to have the same value or importance.

example.ex: ...an increased salary or time off in lieu.

means.word_mean: 1. the function or position properly or customarily occupied or served by another;

auth_sentence.content: Gifts...from insolvent patients who proffered them in lieu of cash.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Gifts...from insolvent patients who proffered them in lieu of cash.

auth_sentence.content: In lieu of a Nets face, he became the face.
auth_sentence.res_content: In lieu of a Nets face, he became the face.

auth_sentence.content: A dirty white rag tied round his throat in lieu of a collar.
auth_sentence.res_content: A dirty white rag tied round his throat in lieu of a collar.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: A dirty white rag tied round his throat in lieu of a collar.

sentences.en: They took cash in lieu of the prize they had won.
sentences.cn: 他们没有领奖品而是领了现金。

sentences.en: We work on Saturdays and have a day off in lieu during the week.
sentences.cn: 我们每星期六上班，平时换休一天。

sentences.en: The company offered us time off in lieu.
sentences.cn: 公司叫我们用休假来代替。
